title: RL33550
content: Countervailing duty laws aim to help domestic industries affected by subsidized imports in the U.S. market. Relief is provided through additional import duties equal to the estimated subsidy amount. Two conditions must be met for relief: the International Trade Commission must find material injury to the domestic industry, and the International Trade Administration must confirm the subsidized imports. The International Trade Administration (ITA) must find that the domestic industry is materially injured by subsidized imports.
